p: The results of this study showed that the EO and carvacrol possessed strong inhibitory activity against C. albicans (isolated from cutaneous and vulvovaginal infections) with average PI values of 103.4% for EO and 113.6% for carvacrol ( Figure 1) and MIC values of 0.47 and 0.24 μL/mL for EO and carvacrol, respectively ( Figure 2). The strong anticandidal activity of EO can, therefore, be correlated with its high content of carvacrol owing to the anticandidal activity of carvacrol which has been previously confirmed [ 48].
